alignment.title: RAxML-NG Parameters
alignment.description: RAxML-NG is a phylogenetic tree inference tool which uses maximum-likelihood (ML) optimality criterion. Its search heuristic is based on iteratively performing a series of Subtree Pruning and Regrafting (SPR) moves, which allows to quickly navigate to the best-known ML tree. RAxML-NG is a successor of RAxML (Stamatakis 2014) and leverages the highly optimized likelihood computation implemented in libpll (Flouri et al. 2014).

raxml_model.title: RAxML-NG Model
raxml_model.description: The substitution model to use for the alignment (see https://github.com/amkozlov/raxml-ng/wiki/Input-data#evolutionary-model)

raxml_starting_trees.title: Number of Starting Trees
raxml_starting_trees.description: The number of trees (generated by parsimony-based randomized stepwise addition) to generate (default: 10)

raxml_bs_trees.title: Number of Bootstrap Trees
raxml_bs_trees.description: The number of bootstrap trees to generate (default: 10)
